SENT.plain: We report the case of a 54-year-old woman who presented with findings of a typical acute cerebrovascular accident, which was found to be caused by emboli from an unsuspected atrial myxoma
Unrelated aortic regurgitation also was present
Surgery was performed to remove the tumor; however, the patient remained with a left hemiparesis
The pitfalls of misdiagnosis are discussed and the need for early use of echocardiography in the work-up of stroke victims is suggested
